definition: palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale

sentences.english: Curse of the Golden Flower takes place mostly within the confines of the palace itself.
sentences.chinese: 《滿城盡帶黃金甲》大部分故事發生在宮廷裏面。

sentences.english: Frankish poet and prelate at the court of Charlemagne.
sentences.chinese: 法蘭克詩人和查理曼宮廷的高級教士。

sentences.english: For a formal occasion at the palace you must wear tails.
sentences.chinese: 在宮廷正式的場合中，你應該穿燕尾服。

sentences.english: The princess had five ladies-in-waiting in the palace.
sentences.chinese: 公主在宮廷裏有五個侍者。

sentences.english: Almond tea was introduced by the civil court of a snack.
sentences.chinese: 杏仁茶是由宮廷傳入民間的一種風味小喫。

sentences.english: Can be seen at the time, Chinese prickly ash as a tribute dedicated source of local officials and the court had.
sentences.chinese: 可見在當時，漢源花椒就作爲貢品獻給官府和宮廷了。

sentences.english: One day two men came to the court .
sentences.chinese: 一天有兩個人到宮廷裏來。

sentences.english: With the court, chocolate moves in by via the blue Danube.
sentences.chinese: 隨着宮廷的遷移，巧克力也風靡了藍色多瑙河。

sentences.english: The third movement menuetto brings images ofcourtly balls and high tea.
sentences.chinese: 第三樂章的小步舞曲帶來宮廷舞會和高級茶會的景象。

sentences.english: Court clothes, for all our party.
sentences.chinese: 宮廷禮服，爲我們的宴會準備。

sentences.english: One day two rascals appeared at the court.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，兩個無賴出現在宮廷之上。

sentences.english: Cryptology was born among people, later circulated into the palace, and became popular among scholars.
sentences.chinese: 隱語產生於民間，後漸入宮廷，逐步士人化。

sentences.english: There is "ice play" painting by Qing Dynasty painter at the National Palace Museum.
sentences.chinese: 故宮至今藏有清代宮廷畫師描摹的《冰嬉圖》。

sentences.english: This is a performance in a teahouse of Beijing .
sentences.chinese: 這是北京老茶館裏上演的一段表演，清朝宮廷舞。

sentences.english: This superb wootz dagger is also known as Ottoman Court Dagger.
sentences.chinese: 這把莊嚴的伍茲鋼匕首是土耳其宮廷匕首。

definition: handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
